SEARCH
Package org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler

Class DefaultIMAPHandler

java.lang.Object
org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler.DefaultIMAPHandler
All Implemented Interfaces:
AuthenticatedHandler, ClientConnected, NotAuthenticatedHandler, SelectedHandler
public class DefaultIMAPHandler extends Object implements ClientConnected, NotAuthenticatedHandler, AuthenticatedHandler, SelectedHandler
Default IMAP handler implementation that accepts all operations.

This handler provides passthrough behaviour using the configured Realm and MailboxFactory. It is used as the default when no custom handler factory is configured on the server.

All operations are accepted and performed using the Mailbox API. Subclasses can override specific methods to add custom policy logic.

Author:
Chris Burdess

  • Method Details

    • connected

      public void connected(ConnectionInfo info, ConnectedState state)
      Description copied from interface: ClientConnected
      Called when a new client connection is established.

      This is called immediately after the TCP connection is accepted and any TLS handshake is completed (for implicit TLS connections). The handler should evaluate whether to accept this connection and call the appropriate method on the state interface.

      The connection information includes:

      • Client and server socket addresses
      • TLS status and certificate information (if secure)

      To accept the connection, call state.acceptConnection() with a greeting message and the handler for the not-authenticated state. To reject, call state.rejectConnection().

      Specified by:
      connected in interface ClientConnected
      Parameters:
      info - connection information (addresses, TLS status)
      state - operations available for responding

    • disconnected

      public void disconnected()
      Description copied from interface: ClientConnected
      Called when the connection is closed for any reason.

      This may be called at any point in the protocol if the client disconnects, the server closes the connection, or an error occurs. Implementations should clean up any per-connection resources.

      Specified by:
      disconnected in interface ClientConnected

    • authenticate

      public void authenticate(Principal principal, MailboxFactory factory, AuthenticateState state)
      Description copied from interface: NotAuthenticatedHandler
      Called after the Realm has authenticated a user.

      The connection has already verified credentials using the Realm (via LOGIN command or AUTHENTICATE SASL). The handler now makes a policy decision on whether to allow access.

      To accept, open the user's mailbox store using the factory and call AuthenticateState.accept(org.bluezoo.gumdrop.mailbox.MailboxStore, org.bluezoo.gumdrop.imap.handler.AuthenticatedHandler). To reject, call one of the reject methods on the state.

      Specified by:
      authenticate in interface NotAuthenticatedHandler
      Parameters:
      principal - the authenticated principal from the Realm
      factory - factory for opening the user's mailbox store
      state - operations for accepting or rejecting

    • select

      public void select(MailboxStore store, String mailboxName, SelectState state)
      Description copied from interface: AuthenticatedHandler
      Called when the client sends SELECT command.

      SELECT opens a mailbox for read-write access.

      Specified by:

      Parameters:

      state - operations for responding
